query_1.text: How did William Shakespeare's use of iambic pentameter and innovative character development contribute to the evolution of English drama?

query_2.text: In what ways did Jane Austen's novels challenge the societal norms of her time and influence the portrayal of women in literature?

query_3.text: How did Charles Dickens's experiences in poverty shape the themes of social justice and reform in his literary works?

query_4.text: In what ways did George Orwell's political views and experiences in the Spanish Civil War inform the themes of totalitarianism and oppression in his writings?

query_5.text: How did Virginia Woolf's contributions to modernist literature and her exploration of stream-of-consciousness narrative techniques impact the literary landscape of the 20th century?

query_6.text: In what ways did Emily Bronte's unique narrative style and themes of nature and isolation in 'Wuthering Heights' reflect her personal beliefs and experiences?
